overview:
Lee is a software developer who focuses on scaling large projects. He has background in system administrations. He’s been involved in dozens of product launches, and claims to specialize in eliminating bottlenecks and optimizing infrastructures. Although his experience spans Win/Lin/Mac, he “gave up” Windows after an unfortunate dinner on Bill Gate’s lawn, and now runs linux on nearly everything.

Lee dropped out of Michigan State University in 2008 to attend the Burning Man festival in Reno, NV, and to escape the perpetual grey skies there. He now works for his own company in San Diego, Leeward Bound Corp, where he writes software to try to save the world.
